items.title: dish; cuisine; vegetables
items.comment: Refers to dishes or cuisine, often used when talking about food.

items.title: very
items.comment: Common adverb used for emphasis, like 'very'. Often pairs with adjectives.

items.title: delicious
items.comment: Literally 'good to eat', used to describe tasty food.

items.title: to make; to do
items.comment: Common verb for making or doing something, including cooking.

items.title: Is Chinese food delicious?
items.comment: Used to ask if Chinese food tastes good.

items.title: Chinese food is very delicious.
items.comment: Used to express that Chinese food is very tasty.

items.title: Can you cook Chinese food?
items.pinyin: nǐ huì zuò Zhōngguó cài ma?
items.pronounce: nee hway dzwaw jong-gwaw tsai ma?
items.comment: Used to ask if someone knows how to cook Chinese food.

items.title: I can’t cook.
items.comment: Negative answer meaning the speaker doesn't know how to cook (implied: Chinese food).
